list.name: Dynamic
list.desc: When 1, mesh is in bind pose; when 0, it isn't. Most likely has further implications.

list.name: Material Index
list.desc: Index of the material used by all triangles in this mesh.

list.name: Default Bone Index
list.desc: Apparently does nothing. Usually points to a dummy bone named after the model, possibly just for labelling.

list.name: Bone Indices
list.desc: Indexes of bones in the bone collection which may be used by vertices in this mesh.

list.name: Face Sets
list.desc: Triangles in this mesh.

list.name: Vertex Buffers
list.desc: Vertex buffers in this mesh.

list.name: Vertices
list.desc: Vertices in this mesh.

list.name: Vertex Count
list.desc: The number of vertices in this mesh.

list.name: Minimum
list.desc: Minimum extent of the mesh.

list.name: Maximum
list.desc: Maximum extent of the mesh.

list.name: Unknown
list.desc: Unknown; only present in Sekiro.

list.name: Name
list.desc: Corresponds to the name of a bone in the parent skeleton. May also have a dummy name.

list.name: Parent Index
list.desc: Index of the parent in this FLVER's bone collection, or -1 for none.

list.name: Child Index
list.desc: Index of the first child in this FLVER's bone collection, or -1 for none.

list.name: Next Sibling Index
list.desc: Index of the next child of this bone's parent, or -1 for none.

list.name: Previous Sibling Index
list.desc: Index of the previous child of this bone's parent, or -1 for none.

list.name: Position
list.desc: Translation of this bone.

list.name: Rotation
list.desc: Rotation of this bone; euler radians.

list.name: Scale
list.desc: Scale of this bone.

list.name: Bounding Box: Minimum
list.desc: Minimum extent of the vertices weighted to this bone.

list.name: Bounding Box: Maximum
list.desc: Maximum extent of the vertices weighted to this bone.

list.name: Unknown
list.desc: Unknown; only 0 or 1 before Sekiro.

list.name: Position
list.desc: Location of the dummy point.

list.name: Forward
list.desc: Vector indicating the dummy point's forward direction.

list.name: Upward
list.desc: Vector indicating the dummy point's upward direction.

list.name: Reference ID
list.desc: Indicates the type of dummy point this is (hitbox, sfx, etc).

list.name: Bone Index
list.desc: Presumably the index of a bone the dummy points would be listed under in an editor. Not known to mean anything ingame.

list.name: Bone Index
list.desc: Presumably the index of a bone the dummy points would be listed under in an editor. Not known to mean anything ingame.

list.name: Attach Bone Index
list.desc: Index of the bone that the dummy point follows physically.

list.name: Use Upward Vector
list.desc: If false, the upward vector is not read.

list.name: Unknown
list.desc: Unknown; only used in Sekiro.

list.name: Unknown
list.desc: Unknown; only used in Sekiro.

list.name: Flags
list.desc:
FaceSet Flags on this FaceSet.

None - Just your average everyday face set.
LodLevel1 - Low detail mesh.
LodLevel2 - Really low detail mesh.
EdgeCompressed - Not confirmed, but suspected to indicate when indices are edge-compressed.
MotionBlur - Many meshes have a copy of each faceset with and without this flag. If you remove them, motion blur stops working.

list.name: Triangle Strip
list.desc: Whether vertices are defined as a triangle strip or individual triangles.

list.name: Cull Backfaces
list.desc: Whether triangles can be seen through from behind.

list.name: Indices Count
list.desc: The number of indices this face set has.

list.name: Name
list.desc: Identifies the mesh that uses this material, may include keywords that determine hideable parts.

list.name: Material Path
list.desc: Virtual path to an MTD file.

list.name: Textures
list.desc: Textures used by this material.

list.name: GX Index
list.desc: Index to the flver's list of GX lists.

list.name: Unknown
list.desc: Unknown; only used in Sekiro.

list.name: Type
list.desc: The type of texture this is, corresponding to the entries in the MTD.

list.name: Path
list.desc: Network path to the texture file to use.

list.name: Layout Index
list.desc: Index to a layout in the FLVER's layout collection.

list.name: Terminator ID
list.desc: Value indicating the terminating item; typically int.MaxValue, sometimes -1.

list.name: Terminator Length
list.desc: The length in bytes of the terminator data block; most likely not important, but varies in original files.

list.name: ID
list.desc: In DS2, ID is just a number; in other games, it's 4 ASCII characters.

list.name: Unknown
list.desc: Unknown; typically 100.

list.name: Data
list.desc: Raw parameter data, usually just a bunch of floats
